intro: Lesliea, commonly known as the sandhill lily, is a genus of flowering plants native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. These plants are characterized by their striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring and summer. Lesliea species often grow in sandy or rocky soils, thriving in well-drained environments. They are part of the Amaryllidaceae family, which includes other ornamental and economically important plants. The genus is noted for its ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity and its aesthetic value in horticulture.
